dialog: Hast thou a round-necked jumper?
Indeed. Our collection of jumpers is most extensive.
May I don this one for a try?
Of course, be my guest.
The hue is too bold for my age, I should prefer a lighter shade.
So Dick, shall we procure some coffee this eve?
Coffee? I have not a fondness for that sort of fare.
Come now, thou canst at least give it a try, alongside thy cigarette.
What is wrong with that? Cigarette is my madness.
Not for me, Dick.
Thou art charging me ten galleons for a motion picture I never ordered or viewed.
Allow me to consult your record, sir. It appears thou viewed 'Titanic' on Monday eve.
Well, the record hath an error. I was at a concert on Monday eve.
Thy word outweighs the record, sir. One moment, if you please.
I knew thou wouldst see it my way.
Sir, I have deleted the ten galleons, but I must add a two galleon service charge to thy bill.
Am I in the Twilight Zone? Thou art charging me for a motion picture I never viewed?
Do not hold me accountable, sir. Blame the wizard who wrote the code.
This is robbery on the highway! I shall summon the Aurors!
If it brings thee comfort, other guests have expressed similar sentiments.
